channel.title: Nitendo Ds help?
channel.description:
Well I borrowed a Nintendo Ds lite from a buddy, and was wondering is their anyways to get roms on it?Without buying a r4ds or magic card as they are called I think..Since I just want to play a few games which I would rather not buy since its not my ds,
So if anyone knows a way I could get roms on it without spending much at all,please tell me.
Please and thanks.

item.title: Nitendo Ds help?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Yup I know about R4 but I would rather not since I am only borrowing it for about a week,therfore I would rather not spend $50 or whatever the amount is to buy a R4,so I was asking for alternative way,guess there isnt one.

Read full topic

item.title: Nitendo Ds help?
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I got an R4, it is nice. I suggest it fully, it even has auto dldi or whatever(automatically patches roms or homebrew to work for it), you just need to update the kernel from the site.

Read full topic

item.title: Nitendo Ds help?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

You’ve got to buy a r4ds or sumthing like that for it if you want to play ds roms

item.title: Nitendo Ds help?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

He gave me a couple games to play but they get boring quick,mario 3on3 and mario 64ds,…beat mario 64 and 3on3 is just a bad game imo

Read full topic

item.title: Nitendo Ds help?
item.dc:creator: @ss_Boring_ss Boring_
item.description:
@ss_Boring_ss wrote:

Do you mean free games? Thats not possible enless your in a game shop that has Ds download connection where you can play demo’s. Also why do you have the ds if he didn’t give you any games to play?

Read full topic
